intro: Hieracium polyodon, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in a flat-topped cluster. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium polyodon is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
